hero.subtitle: A student mission to space
hero.tagline: The first Peruvian CubeSat designed and built by students from the National University of Engineering

story.p1: It all started with a shared dream: to prove that Peruvian students can conquer space. Not as spectators, but as protagonists of our own aerospace history.
story.p2: In 2018, a group of students from the National University of Engineering decided it was time to act. Thus, the Chasqui II project was born, named in honor of the messengers of the Inca empire who traveled thousands of kilometers carrying vital information.
story.p3: Today, our CubeSat will carry that innovative spirit beyond our atmosphere, demonstrating that limits only exist to be overcome.

design.title: Design & Marketing
design.description: We create the visual identity of the project and communicate our mission to the world.

management.title: Management & Logistics
management.description: We coordinate resources, timelines, and teams so every piece fits perfectly.

stem.title: STEM
stem.description: The technical heart. Engineers and scientists who design and build the CubeSat.

mission.title: 10 Subsystems,
mission.description: Each subsystem is vital for our mission's success. From power generation to Earth communications, everything works in perfect harmony.

payload.name: Payload
payload.description: Camera and sensors for Earth imaging

computer.name: On-Board Computer
computer.description: Satellite brain, processes data and commands

ground.name: Ground Station
ground.description: Control and monitoring center on Earth

alliances.title: We're not alone in this
alliances.description: We have the support of institutions and organizations that believe in the potential of Peruvian youth to conquer space.
alliances.cta: Does your organization want to be part of this mission?

cta.donationDescription: Your contribution helps us acquire components, finance tests and get closer to space every day.

about.title: Meet
about.subtitle: The student team that is making history in Peruvian aerospace engineering.

history.title: Our History
history.p1: The Chasqui II project was born in 2018 at the National University of Engineering, with the goal of designing, building, and operating the first Peruvian CubeSat developed entirely by students.
history.p2: Our name honors the legendary messengers of the Inca Empire, the Chasquis, who traveled great distances carrying vital information. Today, we carry that legacy to space.
history.p3: We are a multidisciplinary team of more than 60 students from different faculties, united by the passion of taking Peru to space.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.p1: Develop aerospace capabilities in Peru through practical training of students in the design and construction of satellite systems.
mission.p2: Inspire new generations of Peruvians to pursue careers in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.text: Become a reference for student aerospace development in Latin America, demonstrating that with dedication and teamwork, limits only exist to be overcome.

team.title: Leadership
team.subtitle: The leaders guiding our mission to space

project.title: The
project.subtitle: Discover the technology behind our space mission: a nanosatellite with 10 integrated subsystems working in perfect harmony.
project.subsystemsSubtitle: Each component is essential for mission success

payload.name: Payload
payload.description: Earth surface image capture system using high-resolution camera and specialized sensors.

computer.name: On-Board Computer (OBC)
computer.description: The brain of the satellite, responsible for processing data, executing commands, and coordinating all subsystems.

comms.name: Communications (COMMS)
comms.description: Bidirectional link system between the satellite and ground station for data transmission and telecommands.

thermal.name: Thermal Control (TCS)
thermal.description: Keeps all components within their operational temperature range using passive and active techniques.

attitude.name: Attitude Determination and Control (ADCS)
attitude.description: System that determines and controls the satellite's orientation in space to correctly point instruments.

ground.name: Ground Station (GS)
ground.description: Ground control and monitoring center that receives telemetry and sends commands to the satellite.

structure.name: Mechanical Structure
structure.description: Chassis that protects all internal components and complies with CubeSat standards for deployment.

manufacturing.name: Space Manufacturing
manufacturing.description: Manufacturing and assembly processes following aerospace quality standards.

power.name: Power (EPS)
power.description: Electrical power generation, storage, and distribution system for all subsystems.

propulsion.name: Propulsion
propulsion.description: Orbital maneuvering system for altitude adjustments and deorbiting at end of mission.

news.title: & Events
news.subtitle: Stay up to date with the latest advances, events, and achievements of the Chasqui II project.

featured.title: Chasqui II at the Latin American Technology Installation Festival
featured.excerpt: Our team actively participated in FLIT 2024, presenting project advances to the scientific and technological community in the region.

comms.title: Advances in the communications subsystem
comms.excerpt: The COMMS team successfully completed link tests with the ground station antenna.

unitec.title: Chasqui II at UNITEC 2024
unitec.excerpt: We presented our project at the UNITEC congress, receiving valuable feedback from international experts.

newMembers.title: New members join the team
newMembers.excerpt: We welcome 15 new students who join the different areas of the project.

apsco.title: Participation in APSCO
apsco.excerpt: Chasqui II representatives attended the Asia-Pacific Space Cooperation Organization training program.

iac.title: International Astronautical Congress (IAC)
iac.excerpt: Our paper was accepted and presented at the most important congress in the global space industry.

workshop.title: New space soldering workshop
workshop.excerpt: We inaugurated the specialized soldering workshop for CubeSat electronic components.

shop.title: Shop
shop.subtitle: Every purchase helps us fund the project. Take a piece of our space mission with you.

howToBuy.title: How to buy?
howToBuy.description: Click "Buy" to contact us via WhatsApp. We'll coordinate delivery and payment directly with you. We accept cash, Yape, and Plin.
